questions.prompt: 1. In BG 10.1, Krishna says His mystic opulences are known as what?
questions.feedback: Krishna's divine opulences are called vibhutis—His glorious manifestations throughout creation.

questions.prompt: 2. In BG 10.2, what is the result of understanding Krishna's opulences?
choices: Firm faith and devotional service to Krishna
questions.feedback: Understanding Krishna's opulences leads to unshakeable faith and devotion to Him.

questions.prompt: 3. In BG 10.4-5, what are the qualities and births of great liberated souls?
choices: Transcendental, arising from Krishna's energy; they are non-different from Krishna
questions.feedback: Great souls are born of Krishna's transcendental energy and are non-different in quality from Him.

questions.prompt: 4. In BG 10.8, what do those devoted to Krishna understand?
choices: The eternal source of all sources is Krishna; I am in everything through My energy
questions.feedback: The wise recognize Krishna as the source of all emanations and surrender to Him.

questions.prompt: 5. In BG 10.9, what does Krishna say about those who meditate on His opulences?
choices: They engage in My service and fix their minds on Me; they attain peace
questions.feedback: Those who meditate on Krishna's glories with devotion attain peace and communion with Him.

questions.prompt: 6. In BG 10.10, how does Krishna illumine the minds of His devotees?
choices: From within by the lamp of wisdom; He destroys the ignorance within them
questions.feedback: Krishna enlightens the minds of pure devotees from within, destroying their ignorance.

questions.prompt: 7. In BG 10.12-13, who makes the following statement about Krishna: 'You are the Supreme Brahman...'?
choices: All the great sages and Narada Muni
questions.feedback: The great sages and celestial beings testify that Krishna is the Supreme Personality of Godhead.

questions.prompt: 8. In BG 10.15, what does Arjuna ask Krishna to explain?
choices: Krishna to explain His divine opulences, as Arjuna wants to know more
questions.feedback: Arjuna requests Krishna to elaborate on His opulences and divine manifestations.

questions.prompt: 9. In BG 10.20, what does Krishna say about His position in all beings?
choices: I am the Supersoul in the heart of all beings
I am in the sky only
questions.feedback: Krishna dwells as the Supersoul within the heart of every living being.

questions.prompt: 10. In BG 10.25, which celestial musician does Krishna identify Himself with?
questions.feedback: Among the celestial musicians, Krishna is Narada Muni, the greatest devotee and musician.

questions.prompt: 11. In BG 10.28, which animal does Krishna represent?
choices: The serpent Ananta; the king of serpents
questions.feedback: Among all serpents, Krishna is the great serpent Ananta who holds the universe.

questions.prompt: 12. In BG 10.31, what does Krishna say about His glory?
choices: Whatever is glorious is only a fraction of My Brahman energy
It is only in the spiritual world
questions.feedback: All glorious things in creation are merely a fraction of Krishna's infinite energy.

questions.prompt: 13. In BG 10.32, what does Krishna say about His strength?
choices: I am the strength of the strong, devoid of passion and desire
questions.feedback: Krishna is the strength in the strong, free from passion and all desire.

questions.prompt: 14. In BG 10.33, what is Krishna among the letters or sounds?
choices: The letter 'Om', the Supreme Sound Representation
questions.feedback: Among all sounds and mantras, Krishna is the sacred syllable 'Om' itself.

questions.prompt: 15. In BG 10.40-41, what is the limit to Krishna's opulences?
choices: There is no limit; as much as I exist, there is no limit to My opulences
questions.feedback: Krishna's opulences are infinite; a mere fraction of His glory illuminates the universe.

questions.prompt: 16. In BG 10.42, what does Krishna finally tell Arjuna about His knowledge?
choices: All this knowledge of His opulences is complete, but know only a fraction of My creation
questions.feedback: Krishna indicates that even knowing all His opulences, one barely scratches the surface.

questions.prompt: 17. In BG 10.8 (from purport), what is the practical instruction for a sincere seeker?
choices: Surrender to Krishna and meditate on His infinite qualities
questions.feedback: The seeker should meditate on Krishna's transcendental qualities and surrender fully to Him.

questions.prompt: 18. In BG 10.14 (from purport), why does Krishna take birth as Krishna, the son of Vasudeva?
choices: To reveal His opulences and attract sincere devotees
questions.feedback: Krishna's incarnations manifest His divine qualities and attract those who seek Him.

questions.prompt: 19. In BG 10.26, which creator is Krishna among the demigods?
choices: Brahma, the creator of the universe
questions.feedback: Among the demigods, Krishna is Brahma, the creator of all universes.

questions.prompt: 20. In BG 10.24, which mountain does Krishna represent?
choices: Mount Meru, the king of all mountains
questions.feedback: Among mountains, Krishna is Mount Meru, the greatest and most famous.

questions.prompt: 21. In BG 10.30, what does Krishna say about His incarnations?
choices: Whenever there is a need, I descend to protect the righteous
questions.feedback: Krishna descends whenever righteousness declines to protect the righteous.

questions.prompt: 22. In BG 10.2 (from purport), what should devotees concentrate on?
choices: Krishna's opulences to develop firm faith in His supremacy
questions.feedback: Meditating on Krishna's opulences develops unshakeable faith in His supremacy.

questions.prompt: 23. In BG 10.12 (from purport), how should one approach the eternal truths about Krishna?
choices: With reverence and faith; these are confirmed by great sages
questions.feedback: The teachings about Krishna should be accepted with reverence as confirmed by great authorities.

questions.prompt: 24. In BG 10.9 (from purport), what is the perfection described for Krishna's devotees?
choices: Full consciousness of Krishna leads to peace and liberation
questions.feedback: Full Krishna consciousness brings ultimate peace and liberation to devotees.

questions.prompt: 25. In BG 10 (summary), what is the main purpose of Chapter 10?
choices: Revealing Krishna's transcendental opulences and infinite nature to inspire devotion
questions.feedback: Chapter 10 reveals Krishna's infinite opulences to inspire unshakeable faith and devotion.
